segments.advisor_message: When we talk about risk in investments, think of it like driving a car. If you go too fast, the chances of an accident rise. But if you drive safely, you minimize the risk. We want to find a good balance, just like finding a safe speed on the road.
segments.client_message: I, um, see what you mean about the speeding part, but what does that really mean for my investments?

segments.advisor_message: Exactly! Just like driving, you also have different routes you can take in investing. Some routes may have bumps along the way, which represent high-risk investments, while others are smoother—those are your lower-risk options.
segments.client_message: Right, but, um, how do I know which route to take? I mean, like, what's safe enough for me?

segments.advisor_message: Great question! It’s all about your comfort level and goals. If you're looking for a stable income, you might prefer those smoother paths, like bonds. If you’re young and want to grow your wealth, you could handle the bumps, like stocks.
segments.client_message: Got it, so, um, if I go for the bumps, what does that even mean in dollars and stuff? Like, what can I expect?
